dubstep.solution.optimizer

Class Optimizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • dubstep.solution.optimizer.Optimizer

  • public class Optimizer
extends java.lang.Object
    Optimizer works in conjunction with subclasses of PlanRewrite to rewrite a tree of Operators into a more efficient form. Most of the heavy-lifting done by the optimizer is in PlanRewrite and the individual optimizations themselves. As of the time this comment was written, the following optimizations exist. - PushSelections applies a standard push-down selections optimization. Selections are partitioned into conjunctive clauses, and each clause is pushed down through Joins, Selections, and Projections, as far as it will go. - SpecializeJoins translates NLJ Joins into HASH Joins by merging in SelectionNode conditions. As in PushSelections, these are grabbed by pulling out conjunctive clauses. - EvaluateExpressions compiles Expression terms into more compact forms. This takes two forms: - Partial Evaluation reduces expressions such as 1 + 1. - Nested Subqueries are compiled. (See expr.EvalSubSelect) - BoundedSizeExpressions translates operators with unbounded memory requirements into equivalent operators with bounded memory requirements. For now, this means HASH joins are replaced by Sort operators followed by a MERGE join. Sort operators are not modified -- PlanCompiler picks the correct sort implementation.
